reviewText: If you have already consumed the four major, multi-part documentaries and are looking for something else, this will satisfy. The maps are good. It is by no means a comprehensive work on WWI so if you are looking to start learning about WWI, start elsewhere. Try ""WWI: The Complete Story - 100th Memorial Edition"
Enjoyed it on History channel , and had to buy it.

WWI in 60 minutes? Really? That alone should tell you everything. The DVD cover says "in-depth look into" the war...that's not true. It is a very cursory look into the war. POSITIVES The war footage (although other WWI DVDs have similar/same footage) NEGATIVES It's too short. Too much information is left out. The narration doesn't match the images/video. Most of the time, the narration is independent of the images/video. So, you really don't know what you are seeing. Phrases like "Triple Entente" are used, but not explained. Sometimes they use foreign words to describe situations (i.e., poor communication, subpar understanding). The music is varied and odd. You'll hear some music from the era (good); other times you'll hear modern rock music. And then you'll hear some opera. No maps or diagrams are displayed. It's disorganized; there doesn't appear to be any order to how they presented the information. By topic? By government? Chronological? OTHER This reminds me of a DVD that might be shown to elementary school children. And that's awful, because it does a very poor job at describing WWI. Documentaries like this do not spark interest; and they are not good teaching tools. Are you looking for a decent WWI documentary? Then check-out The First World War - The Complete Series.
